author: enki_0042
title: Paper weight?
review:
I'm not an American, so the Architecture sets don't have any deeper meaning for me, but the models in the series are still all absolutely gorgeous. If you like the Architecture sets, this one of the better ones, but it's still not as fabulous as Fallingwater or the White House, mostly because of it being too small and too easy to build.

If I wasn't collecting the Architecture sets, I probably wouldn't want it, but it does look good on my desk.

author: Smell_o_vision
title: Beautiful yet totally underwhelming at the same time.
review:
"What is this a center for ants? How can we be expected to teach children how to read...if they can't even fit inside the building?"

Pros

  • Beautiful model, despite the small scale.
  • It's a good representation of the real building.
  • â€¦

Cons

  • Lacking in size.
  • Somewhat pricey ($40 USD) for such a small model.
The Guggenheim museum is a beautiful little model.
If you can manage to pick this set up at a discount, or are just an ardent FLW/architecture fan, than I'd recommend getting it.
It makes for a pleasant display piece.
